ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to write short, 20 minute plays.
The fundamentals... what a scene is... BJJ asked on the first day what a scene was and no one answered...
How to write, talk about, revise, and critique plays.
BJJ has incredible insights on process, especially how to write a first draft.
I learned how to write a play, which is something I had tried and failed to do previously.
Basic understanding of short play writing

I learned how to just write, which is incredibly valuable for any writer whether you're just beginning or alreayd have several plays, stories, poems, etc. under your belt. I also learned how to follow my impulses and trust myself. I also learned a lot about how to tackle certain types of plays, like the family drama or meta-play.

I learned a lot of valuable insight about the dos and don'ts of playwriting: how much subtlety is too much, how to write character driven works, how to write dialogue, how to tighten plot-holes, and how to look at a play through other people's eyes to see if my intentions are coming across.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths: a notable and well-respected professor who knows what he is talking about! very clear feedback from the class and professor on how to improve our work
weaknesses: none

Strengths: warm, collaborative workshop, BJJ is a genius
Weaknesses: no readings, which is nice... but also nothing to absorb besides what we talk about in class

Strengths - workshops were always helpful and the class community was wonderful. BJJ is also a great instructor who offered a lot of advice, so it was very easy to learn from each other's work. Weaknesses - I do wish we had the chance to read plays outside of student work, or at least had more reading recommendations.
Strengths: Not too difficult, fun assignments, collaborative work environment, great Prof

Weaknesses: I wish we had three plays workshopped and not two. 

Strengths: workshops are amazing! great class.
I just loved this course. Hearing other peoples plays and getting to workshop my own was so inspiring and the positivity was fantastic.

Having a strict deadline to write two short length plays was really helpful for me as a writer who struggles without the pressure of the deadline. I wish however that this class spent more time on actually teaching the basics of playwriting. Instead it felt like we were thrown in the deep end. Teaching moments from the professor would only come during feedback students' works.

Strengths - BJJ! It was such an honor and blessing to learn from him. He is so down-to-earth, funny, encouraging, and insightful. He has a way of dropping little nuggets of wisdom about writing and playmaking that are genuinely transformative. I also appreciated the ability to just write whatever we wanted for our two plays. The shortform nature of the plays also made it so we could get through more plays faster and try new things. Weaknesses - I wish we had more stuff to do when we were not up for workshop, perhaps reading a play or two or shorter exercises to be completed on our own.

This course gave students so much writing and analysis practice, given that we spent our time writing short-form plays and analyzing each other's work. I only wish that we had perhaps read and analyze some famous plays to see examples of people who mastered certain skills and give us more exposure about ways in which we could tell stories.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Definitely an interesting and fun course.
YES - again, BJJ is a genius but he's also so real
Yes!! I improved significantly as a writer, and it's amazing to have the chance to learn from BJJ.

Yes, absolutely! The class is so fun and collaborative, and if you like playwriting, this will certainly give you the opportunity! How often will you have the chance to write plays and have a class and award-winning playwright workshop them?
Yes!!! Even being in a room with BJJ would be educational enough to sing his praises from the rooftops. The opportunity to ask him questions is unparalleled

ABSOLUTELY!! BJJ is hilarious, insightful, engaged, and incredibly smart. He's a great teacher who pays a lot of attention and has a GIANT amount of experience to share. Go to office hours. Workload was easy and class was a blast.
Absolutely. The professor is amazing and funny and you learn so much from him and your peers.

I would recommend this to someone who is looking for a course to just give them the time to write. However if you are someone looking to be taught the techniques and skills of playwriting this may not be the most useful course.

10000000000%. If you get into this class, you MUST take it. BJJ is truly the best. His class and office hours have been the highlight of my semester. I've definitely grown as a playwright and writer, and BJJ offers incredible advice! I also loved my classmates, and the workshops were so helpful and encouraging. I also loved BJJ's weekly check-ins, where we got to go around and share what we watched or listened to recently. They were a great way to warm up the group and also showed how the things we watch can influence our writing, even if we don't realize it. I also really enjoyed the short play structure. Not only were we able to get through plays faster, we were able to try new things out and experiment. Even if someone wrote something that seemed to be a longer play, the act of even writing a little bit of it was so helpful, and it was very encouraging to just have something written down and see that progress unfold. I genuinely looked forward to this class every week, and I will absolutely miss it. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE TAKE THIS CLASS!

I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. It was so much fun, but also it's so important to consistently write to keep working the muscle, which can be hard given the normal workload of classes, but this class forces you to take time to write, think, and research, which I loved.
